definition[0]: designed for or used by people who have a lot of money
definition[1]: involving goods and services that are expensive and perhaps of good quality compared to other goods etc of the same type, or the people that buy them
definition[2]: to start buying or selling more expensive goods or services
example[4]: The travel operator is trying to lose its cheap image and move upmarket with more exotic destinations.
definition[3]: to change a product or a service, or people’s ideas about it, so that it is or seems to be more expensive and of better quality
example[5]: He took the retailer upmarket, adding European designer clothing to its range.
